content.description:
Bolted face-climb with a bouldery start. Avoid using the large offwidth to escape the interesting moves. 

 *All beta from FO and SJ Fairbanks Area Rock Climbing Guide*
content.protection: 4 bolts and chain anchors accessible from the top
content.location:
Between K-Star's Crack and Breakfast Sandwhich. Bolt line goes up the face right of the off-width.

 *All beta from FO and SJ Fairbanks Area Rock Climbing Guide*

content.description:
Can be lead on small gear or a TR can be set up from the trees 20 ft back from the edge.

 Frank Olive and Stan Justice's Fairbanks Area Climbing Guide
content.location:
Just right of Morning Glory is shallow dihedral running from top to bottom.

 Frank Olive and Stan Justice's Fairbanks Area Climbing Guide

content.description:
"This sharp steep hand crack would be an instant classic it was more than three moves long. Can use the same two toprope bolts as Jinx."

 Frank Olive and Stan Justice's Fairbanks Area Climbing Guide
content.protection: Same bolted anchors as Jinx to the right.
content.location:
"On the far left side of the Mourning Wall is a small gulley. This climb is the steep crack on the left side of the gully."

 Frank Olive and Stan Justice's Fairbanks Area Climbing Guide

content.description:
"Thirty feet from the right end is a short chimney leading to a broad ledge. go up vertical U shaped gully for 5.6 variation or try the diamond shaped face on the left for 5.9. Hard for short climbers." - AAC

 *FAIRBANKS AREA ROCK CLIMBING GUIDE* 5.9 TR 35ft. Right of K Star's Crack is a short dirty chimney leading to a broad ledge. The diamond shaped face on the left looks improbable but has solution holds to be found. Harder for short climbers. Two TR bolts can be reached from the top.
content.location:
30 feet from the right end of the wall.

 *FAIRBANKS AREA ROCK CLIMBING GUIDE* Just right of K Star's Crack, a top the dirty chimney/ledge where two walls meet perpendicularly.

content.description: Approximately 45 ft from the right end of the wall is an offwidth dihedral 5.7; right of the crack is a face with interesting moves that range from 5.7-5.10, hence the name of the route. Bouldery moves at the start and the steeper headwall about 2/3 height mark the cruxes.
content.protection: TR this route or lead the offwidth crack placing large gear as you go. A natural anchor can be built by an easy walkoff up top.
content.location: A confluence of trails encompass this crag making it very accessible for building anchors. No fixed gear on this crag.

content.description: The Morning Wall lies just East of the Twin Towers. This wall tends to receive morning light and remains protected from strong winds that move in from the North. There are a few climbs in this area that are worth doing especially when other areas are occupied.
